The menu options have expanded so it would be worth trying some other items next time.

Not bad service doesn't mean good service. Our waitress could of been friendlier.  Service was on the slower side. Food overall good but not worth the value. Lots of food in the area , to overpay for something that isn't worth it.

I really wanted to like this place but honestly I just wasn't impressed. I ordered the spaghetti bolognese and it was bland and not a very impressive portion given the price. Once I added enough salt to season the dish right, it tasted better and was pretty good. The noodles were cooked well but just not worth the $18 I paid after adding mushrooms.  My husbands pizza, or salad....honestly I don't know what exactly they were going for because it seemed like a dressed salad on top of a pizza crust which was just kinda confusing was okay. The salad itself was tasty but again for $15 the size wasn't impressive and I would be okay with a small size but it just wasn't amazing. Your better off going to mellow mushroom and getting an awesome pie there.  My daughters chicken breast off the kids meal was equally "meh". The only redeeming grace from this place was the nice staff.  So good service but "meh" food is what you can expect from this place.

I have lived in Jacksonville, Florida for 10 years after moving here to escape the cold winters and overcrowded streets of New York City. I have had some of the best food NYC  had to offer. Now that I have been down here for sometime now, I think it time to give restaurants a honest review, because what passed down here for food at some of the trendious restaurants will not work up north.  My overall Rating for California Pizza is two stars. The ambiance of the restaurant was very nice at the time of my visit.. If that is what I was here for I would have given then three stars the overall failing marks came with dinner style & quality utensils and dishes. I order the Garlic Chicken with vegetables. I also had the frozen lemonade to drink.  My lunch date ordered the Mahi mahi Tacos with a glass of Coca-Cola​. To sum up taste of the food, the vegetables were well cooked. The major flaw was the Garlic Chicken. The Chicken was flashed frozen and then cooked. The reason why I say the is because the chicken felt like I was eating a thin layer of chicken fat with rubber underneath it. The picture of the food is very deceiving. My drink was good. My lunch date said that her food was a better looking version of food from Taco bell. So it is sad to say the California Pizza Kitchen has the look and not the taste. They need a lot of important improvements to charge the $ for their food. My total bill was $45 and I would not be eating there anytime soon. They lacked in quality to justify their prices.
Had a great meal. The manager George was fantastic and very personable. Will definitely come back.

Horrible customer service. Was planning on ordering take out and wanted to go Barnes and Noble to kill time before I placed my order because I had time to kill before I needed to bring food home to my family. Parked in the to go parking. The manager sent a young boy to run out and tell me that I couldn't park there and needed to place my order first, which means my food would be cold when I brought it home. They also had 5 other empty to-go spots. I ended up moving my car and ordering from Maggianos instead. They lost a customer and should really focus on more important things instead of assuming I was not going to be shopping there.
Food was disappointing.  Server ignored us.  Can't say I'd go out of my way to come back here. Pretty sad you can walk in and be seated on a Saturday night without a wait.

New year, new you??!!!  I enjoy this place for the two following reasons: 1) The pizza's calories are readily found on all major calorie trackers apps such as My Fitness Pal. This allows me to correctly track my macros each day.  Most pizza places do not have this options and tracking other pizza brands for calories isn't as accurate.   2) The pizza comes in a delicious single serving size. The OG Hawaiian Pizza is only a 1,200 calories compared to Little Caesars 2,500 calories for one pizza of similar size. With pizza that has this much flavor in a restaurant setting, it should be illegal!  I would recommend this place for people who are around the town center and do not want to over do it on the Carbs at "that Italian restaurant" there.  They have a wide arrange of food there that are not pizza as well. And, they have low/zero calorie drink options there as well.  While they are amazing, the avocado egg rolls will destroy your diet and weight loss. Avoid at all cost. Still with a single pizza as your cheat meal; you must avoid most of the appetizers at all cost!!!  The service is usually good there. The last time that I went there, I had a waitress named Michie. She was very polite and quick to help us with the menu. Overall, service there is great. It is only a few time in between shifts that things seem to not function as well. The older lady at the door who sits guest down somehow is always in the bathroom when people come in. IDK if she has a medical condition or what... but both times that I have seen her there... the same issues with customers walking in and no one being at the door was present. If you aren't greeted ASAP at the door, you are safe to assume that it is that old lady in the bathroom.  Be patient.... she is REALLY old.

Okay. First time customer. I ordered The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and Curly Mac 'N' Cheese and they rang up $27. I was expecting to get a HUGE meal with that kind of $$. Nope. Both portions are for one person. I'm cool with it... But I expect this meal to blow my mind! Nope. The BBQ chicken pizza taste JUST LIKE Papa John's. No kidding. It literally just tasted like the 1-topping free pizza I get from Papa John's when you get it in BBQ sauce and chicken topping. Their crust may be better, but literally, nothing else is much different. The Mac n Cheese is barely Mac n Cheese. That cheese is liquid. My first and last visit.
Cameron was absolutely amazing! He knew exactly what he was talking about and what to recommend when I told him what I liked. If you go, ask for him!! he's so great!

Not dog friendly as advertised. Was made to sit outside of patio railing while another patron with a smaller dog sat inside the railing. Not a fun experience being treated like an outcast and my mention of it was dismissed and ignored. Poor management.

My husband & I enjoyed the food at California Pizza Kitchen (CPK).  The service was only okay. It is a casual place with a cafe feel.  I am happy that I decided to try CPK for lunch instead of dinner because the restaurant seems large and fast-paced.   Service was very slow and there were menu items that were not available (ran out).  My husband's unsweet tea glass remained empty for several minutes.  We had to ask a different server to fill the glass because ours had disappeared.   Parties with strollers are asked to leave the stroller at the hostess stand, i.e., the stroller drop.  I found the 5-6 strollers around the hostess stand to be very tacky and irresponsible of the restaurant.  The hostess was not always at the front to monitor the strollers.  I've never seen a stroller drop at a restaurant before (I don't have children), so this was very strange to me. The food was tasty!  I ordered a flatbread as my second selection - My first selection was unavailable.  My husband ordered a pizza and we decided to try a mini-plate of fried mac & cheese.  We had not seen/tried fried mac & cheese before then, so we had to try it - 'Merica!.  We enjoyed ALL of our food! We will definitely be back for more CPK!

We took our nephews there for dinner on a Saturday night. Town Center was hopping, so we expected a long wait. Actually, it only took about 25 minutes....not too bad.  The hostesses were super friendly, and even came outside to let us know that our table was ready. Our server was Chaz. FABULOUS!!! Extremely friendly & patient!  We started off with white corn guacamole & chips. It was wonderful.  One nephew got the jambalaya fettuccine. Little spicy, but very tasty. I got the four cheese ravioli with sautéed mushrooms. OMG. Melt in your mouth goodness! The rest of our group got pizzas- meat cravers ( huge pieces of meat) , Margherita, and Thai (lots of crunchy veggies on top).  The food, the service & the atmosphere made for a great night.

I really enjoy eating at the bar at CPK b/c I love watching them work.  My husband and I commented that they really know what they are doing here as far as operations go and you can tell they run like a well oiled machine. Man were they cranking out the food in record time on Saturday during lunch.  We stopped in for a quick bite while out shopping and I let mister pick what we ordered. He went with the California Club on thin crust. (this particular pizza isn't normally offered on thin crust but you can have any of them made on thin crust for $1.50 more)  The pizza tasted great, but my only complaint would be that there were too many toppings piled on so it was rather difficult to eat.  All in all I think CPK is one of the better places to stop in for a quick yet delicious lunch if you're out walking around the Town Center Mall.

I like California Kitchen, but I cannot say that I love it or look forward to eating there for months in advance.  I know everyone talks about how great it is, but in the Towncenter it is not my first choice for great food nor is it my second. However, after clarifying my personal opinions, CK is a good dining spot.  Service is always prompt and proffesional, food is consitently good and I often think consistency is one of the most important ingredients to a successful restaurant.  I guess I have just not found that "wow" item on the menu that I really love, but my family sure has and they love going there.

If your looking for a great choice for gluten free pizza this is the place to go. The margarita gluten free pizza is so delicious and doesn't taste like I'm eating a piece of paper with sauce on it. I have been gluten free for two years now and this is the first chain restaurant to get it right. Service is so so and it can be busy but they are always friendly and kind.

Well i remember food being better than it was tonight.Had the carnitos & fish tacos, quinoa & arugula salad. Nothing was really flavored well and service was mediocore..no wonder we walked right in and sat down on a saturday night when there was an hour wait every where else. Not terrible, but not WOW!

Came to the restaurant at 9:20 on a Monday night. The doors were ALREADY closed. On the door it said they close at 9:30. We knocked. The girl said were closed and have shut the kitchen down. First time having this kinda of service in the US.
Love the Thai chopped salad!  Staff are friendly and diverse. Never had a bad meal here!

We waited for 30 minutes and no one ever came to take our order or ask for drinks and the people that got here AFTER us got drinks already. Even though that happened, when the server Ellie came, everything became better and her service was great. Especially the food. It was delicious and very nicely decorated.

The last time I went to CPK, I had a less-than-satisfactory experience. The food was either salty or just didn't taste like it was described as. This time, however I had an experience that signified a significant improvement at this location. Don't get me wrong, I actually loved CPK. There was this brilliant location about 15 minutes from my old home in Southern California, where you had a view that would rival those experienced by Marco Polo in Asia. The food there was certainly on par for the price bracket and it's a shame that I haven't been there in seven years. I visited CPK's Jacksonville location about four times since its opening and found it underwhelming. Obviously, since it was CALIFORNIA Pizza Kitchen, and not FLORIDA Pizza Kitchen, you would expect the highest quality establishments to be concentrated around the chain's area of origin. (This is something that most chain businesses should avoid doing yet it seems to be a recurring pattern with some.) Tonight I went to California Pizza Kitchen again, having received a call from my father who invited me to join him and my mother. He just got 100 dollars worth of gift cards for CPK and I thought that my brother, sister and I could join them.        The location itself was chosen when the Saint John's Town Centre was in no shortage of open real estate in prime locations. (CPK is located near the ever-so-popular Turtle Pond, sharing a circle with Starbucks, Teavana and Maggiano's Little Italy. It's hard to get such openings in the main area of the TC unless you're a multi-billion dollar company that can commission an entire new complex for you're store. I'm looking at you,Nordstrom.) As a result of this, CPK usually gets plenty of customers. (At least more than its neighbour: "The Art of Shaving" would ever get.) On an occasion, CPK can have 90+ minute waiting lists. We caught the place on a nice, quiet, meaningless Friday, which allowed us to enjoy our meal in the quiet, serene setting. We had Avacado Chicken Rolls as an appetiser. The crunchy wonton-like shell blended with the warm, flavourful filling. Which contained tomatoes, bacon and chicken. It was served with a spicy, creamy sauce and a non-spicy sauce of the same texture. For our entrée, we had three varieties of pizza: Habanero Carnitas, a soft- crusted pizza with a "habanero element" that wasn't actually as spicy as a real habanero pepper, but still enjoyable due to its well seasoned pork. Chipotle Chicken, a pizza with a semi-thick crust, which like the Habanero Carnitas, shares Mexican influence. The Chipotle Chicken featured tender grilled chicken, a seasoning that actually made it spicier than the Habanero Carnitas, and a Pico de Gallo topping. The pizza is served with a spicy chipotle sauce on the side that is sure to add a nice kick. Lastly we had the "Pear+Gorgonzola" a thin-crusted, crunchy masterpiece. The Pear+Gorgonzola, (which I will call the PG) was not only delicious due to the overall execution of the recipe, but the idea itself. CPK dared to experiment with unlikely ideas, and created one of the best slices of Pizza I have eaten. (It sits right up there some of the stuff that comes out of Libretto's, my all-time-favourite pizzeria.)    The PG is a sweet, yet slightly sour pizza, which is served as a regular pizza with Gorgonzola Cheese, which gives it the strong, Blue Cheese type flavour. The PG also includes some sliced pears, which taste like very delicious pears, and add to the sweetness of the pizza. There are some herbs and stuff, and the whole thing's served below a bed of salad with more Gorgonzola. I suppose what made the PG so spectacular is the flavour contrast, which was a risky move for CPK, yet one most rewarding. The meal overall was the highlight of my day. I think it is safe to say that California Pizza Kitchen, to me has redeemed itself. 4.8/5 stars.

My first taste of CPK was during a short port call in Hawaii. A friend of mine said it was a must stop for dinner, especially if we had never eaten there. It's been a long time since then, just over seven years, but CPK finally made their debut in Jacksonville a few years ago. I, typically, visit CPK on Veteran's Day. This is because of all the chain restaurants around town, I can get in and get out fairly quickly by choosing to sit at the bar rather than a table. Given that our CPK is located in the St. John's Town Center, this is quite the miracle.   Although, I haven't come to CPK and actually sat down on at a table, I know my opinion is fairly limited. It is, however, disappointment-free. I'm very happy that CPK has the option of sitting at the bar. If they didn't, they would probably turn away a ton of customers. The folks, like myself, who want to get in for a quick bite are just as important as the family of five. The other great part about the bar is being able to watch the employees construct meals and to see that huge brick oven.  I had a slight annoyance during my last visit to CPK, but it was nothing to do with the employees. I had to work on Veteran's Day and went to CPK for my lunch. The bar had a few empty seats, but not enough for this party of five (a mother and four teenage girls) that walked straight to the back. The entire group continually hovered over everyone at the bar, tried to get folks to move down from where they were seated (which wouldn't give enough seats for their whole party anyways) and were very rude. Finally, the waitress in charge of the bar area asked them to leave and profusely apologized to all of us that were sitting. She told us to take our time and eat and not let ourselves be rushed. I'm glad that the waitress had enough care to handle the situation before it got way out of hand.   As I only seem to make it over to the Town Center sparingly, and usually not to eat, I haven't tried anything else on CPK's menu other than pizza. Of the pizzas that I have had, I haven't been disappointed. The ingredients harken back to my time in Sicily and the crust is perfectly cooked. Given my New England roots, I have been spoiled by great Italian food, especially pizza, all my life. CPK is right up there with some of the best from back home for me. I see a few fellow Yelpers drawing a comparison between CPK and Mellow Mushroom. I don't feel that the comparison is fair. The styles of each chain are very different. For myself, I can tell the difference between a pizza from CPK and a pizza from Mellow and I like both. Each style of pizza has its own unique qualities.  I do need to actually go and enjoy a sit down meal. Now that I have my new job just a few minutes up the road on Beach Blvd, I'm sure that I can conquer that task in the near future.
I was not impressed. Server wasn't that good, no personality or attitude about her. Cold shrimp that was supposed to be grilled and a cold pizza. Good hummus, that's about it.

A brand new California Pizza Kitchen in St. John's Town Center! Woohoo!   Yes, its a chain store.  But a large variety of pie's!  There is something for everyone here.   There were 4 of us so we each got different pizzas and we tried all of them.  The following are our ratings:   California club pizza-B+  Four seasons pizza-A+  This one was the best of all of them!  Pepperoni pizza-B not enough pepperoni Spinach & artichoke pizza-B-  Renee, from Orlando (its on the nametag) Our server was absolutely wonderful! We'd definitely return again.

Only came here for the butter cake which is  uh...MAZING!!!! Guess I should choose something for lunch since I am already here.  Everything else on the menu is okay but the reason for the five stars is simply for that "to die for" cake!

Being a chain restaurant, there is only so much I can say for different locations other than report on the hospitality. We ordered the white pizza which has ricotta cheese, spinach, mozzarella, and garlic. I usually have a decent experience but at this location I didn't feel that our waitress made any attempt to establish a connection or short lived friendship with us. She was not very nice and didn't seem to have any input/recommendations when we were still struggling with what to order and asking questions. It was not busy so it was not that she did not have the time. We also noted that she seemed to be rushing us out. It was less than an average visit.

Alright, let me confess this first. I love California Pizza Kitchen and I am obsessed with it. I was visiting Florida from Maryland and there is no way I'd miss trying any CPK in my way. Food is good as always. Service is great. But,3 star because, one of the reasons I go to CPK every week is for their food which includes the warm bread they serve with olive oil (yummm) And when I went to this place, I was really hungry as we were driving from MD to FL and tired from the shopping I couldn't resist doing in the mall this place is in. So, naturally I wanted to pounce on the bread before I got my food and they literally brought 3 pieces of bread for a table of 3 people !!!! Yes,I have a problem with that :/ This never happens in our local CPK. Give out some more bread,dammit.
Great fettuccine with chicken. This is my third time coming here and I've ordered the same thing each time it's perfect.. Great service as well..

It's OK but nothing to rave about. You want pizza, legit pizza? Go to a pizza place, a legit pizza place...but I suppose if all you have is Cal. Pizza Kitchen around you then go there. Their salads are good. I tried the Moroccan one and the Arugula/Quinoa one...both very good. Service was nice and the outdoor seating gave it a nice touch.

We have been here a few times now and have always had the pizza and it has been consistent and delish everytime. Our only negative thing to say is we wish there pizza came in different size bacause the white pizza we normally get is enough for the two of us. But they have great pizza.

We come to Jacksonville once in a while and this is our second time eating here and both times have been great service and even better pizza. I will always make time to swing by when I'm in Jacksonville again.
Excellent location in the shopping district around. Service was of great quality too. One of the pizzas was slightly crispier for our liking and compared to the same one at other locations as well.

CPK made it to Jax! I remember when I fell in love with CPK when I was in Hawaii many moons ago. They were super busy since they recently opened and it was a little frustrating to have to wait when there were no stores open to meander through, but it was worth the wait.  We started with the white bean guacamole. It was different & refreshing and got our taste buds prepared for what was to come. My husband ordered a sandwich while I stuck to the must-have pizza. I ordered the BBQ Chicken. One word: Classic.  While the portions were huge and we each were able to bring food home, we'll definitely be going back and just making smarter decisions about what we order.
If your feeling for classy pizza on a date night. you can't go wrong with this place.

Don't know why but for some reason we never went to CA Pizza Kitchen. I am sure we will be coming there more often now. We shared handmade mushroom pizza and each of us ordered soups. Everything was delicious.

Yes, I know it's a chain, but it's one of the very FEW chains that I've fancied since back in the day. Andddd the busiest CPK location in the US? Yup...Hawaii (there's only 1 CPK). I was surprised our server (Jordan) this evening knew that. However, truth be told, I actually like the St. Johns Town Center location much better as far as size (larger) and atmosphere (fresh and fancy). We arrived later in the evening for dinner (around 7 p.m.), and though the place was hoppin', we were seated well within 5 minutes. I love the "chill mode" vibe here. Lights were dimmed, staff was polite and welcoming, swanky ultra modern decor that was easy on the eyes...all made for a very delightful visit. Food: I ordered a starter of mediterranean focaccia bread off their "small plates" menu to share with mom and family friend. The bread had cheese and herbs baked in, and was very delish when dipped in the olive oil and parmesan. Soon after, my all-time fave, the White Pizza (mozzarrela, ricotta, parmesan, pecorino romano,sauteed spinach, and roasted garlic) was set before me. I love, love, LOVE this pizza. Cheesy crusty goodness, and the touch of garlic fuses everything together. Never a disappointment.  Mom went with the California Veggie Pizza (baby broccoli, eggplant, corn, red onions, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, mozzarella, and tomato sauce), and requested a whole wheat crust. She said it was very flavorful, but she had hoped that there would be more of an abundance of veggies on her pizza, that they were pretty scattered. Family friend...based on a recommendation from our server...had the mac n cheese. I had a couple bites and thought it was very good and not artificial-tasting. She liked it as well, but wanted a deeper and more prominent cheese flavor.  Service: Spot on from the get-go, thank you, Jordan. Great, positive demeanor, and knowledgeable of menu items and ingredients. Drinks never went empty, and food was fresh and delicious. I'll definitely be back in the near future to try the patio seating!

I've been here before and food was ok. Today, it wasn't. The quesadilla was supposed to be a small plate. Yep! Four tiny slices with almost nothing inside next to a huge bowl of sauce. That's huge by comparison. Tasted ok but more like an appetizer. I then ordered a wedge salad. Better size but almost tasteless. How is anything with bacon not tasty? Too many other nearby options. Skip this place.
Tbvh, the only reason I come here is for the different varieties for pizza. Parking and service could be much better, though is not horrible. The prices are a bit high for pizza.

tried multiple times and I do believe they need to improve their customer service from host to servers. also the chairs were dirty and they didnt even bother to ask if we need to move to different chair. to be clear we came in around 8:30 which isnt busy time in here

I love CPK. I have been three or four times over the past year. The food and service have always been reliably great. There is a good variety of food on the menu and I would recommend this restaurant to families or couples. If the prices were a tiny bit cheaper, it would get all five stars from me.

Very filling personal pizzas. Got the Sicilian pizza which was thin-crust and delicious. There were bits of time when we felt the waiting lasted longer than it should have. But otherwise, solid pizza.

Used to love this place - today will be my last visit.  Ordered Hawaiian Pizza add mushrooms.  When pizza arrived - no mushrooms. Instead of making new pizza, they took the pizza back to kitchen and threw raw mushrooms on it and baker for a minute. So cold raw mushrooms and dried out pizza not my idea of good food.  With so many options for eating you would think taking care of customers would be priority.  To make matters worse it was the manager who did this.

I took my daughter to CPK last year in november 2013. The last incident my daughter had a hair in her food. I discreetly told the server and she did apologize and replaced the pizza.  What I am most upset no one from management  came over to apologize or ask if everything was ok. I did call their guest services number and my information and received a call from a female employee who did not identify herself. Her response was uncaring and arrogant and stated we replaced your pizza. My point is that they should have apologized to keep me as a customer. Even when I called their corporate office their regional gave me lipservice after explaining the situation. I stated all I wanted was and apology and it would be a nice token to give something to win back my business after the biggest faux pas in the food business. I am a graduate from the Art Institute in Culinary Management  to be a chef.   Wish you guys would learn that its cheaper to keep a regular customer then gain a new one..  I"m also a MBA student so I'm not talking out the side of my neck. CPK I won't step foot again ever  nor buy your frozen pizza at publix. I've facebook and twitter about this . So I hope people will know how uncaring you really are.

I have 2 small dogs. They come with me everywhere. This CPK is the only restaurant I've ever eaten at where I wasn't permitted to bring the dogs/ dog on the patio, when I questioned why.. "Why aren't the dogs allowed on the patio area on the ground, but birds and others are on the tables when the restaurant is closed".. Which do you prefer??? Dogs on the ground or birds pooping where you eat?"

Love this chain! Flavored teas are so awesome, just ask for more syrup! Creative pizzas as usual and a friendly family atmosphere. Pick a specialty pizza and avocado egg rolls, can't go wrong. Staff are alert and friendly. Quick service even at peak dinner rush.

I would like to preface this review by acknowledging that this was the first time I'd visited this location. I am open to trying it again, as I realize there is at least one crap server at every restaurant...my server was exceptionally incompetent at CPK. I tend to surround myself with a pretty attractive group of ladies. Never did I imagine that this would be to my detriment. On this visit, there were 4 of us dining. I'm going to go out on a limb and say this was our server's first serving job, and he must have been new. If you don't know how to manage a lunch rush, the least you can do is acknowledge your inability to do your job. That way, at least your table knows you know the exist. Apparently this guy had a soft spot in his heart for Italians (much to my dismay, as one of the women dining with us was full-blooded Sicilian). Once he finally showed up to the table, he went out of his way to accommodate ONE person at the table...the saucy Italian. Great. All I wanted was a water. Just a water. Is it too much to ask to refill my water, along with the Italian's, when they're both empty? We're in FLORIDA in the middle of SUMMER. This is not a tall request.  We sat for an excessively long time after being greeted, so when he was walking by, I politely asked if we could place our order and he scoffed and explained to me that he had several tables and he was working as fast as he could. Sorry bro, doesn't work for me. I've been in your shoes an I know how this is supposed to go. Considering he'd visited all his other tables around us TWICE already, I wasn't sympathetic, and decided it was our turn.  Bad move. He literally ignored my drink for the entire meal. The Italian (and no one else) was accommodated prior to her even requesting things. The best part was, after chewing on ice to make the point that I was clearly being neglected, he turned to the saucy Italian and asked her if she'd like a water to go.  I honestly couldn't tell you what I ordered, how it tasted, what the restaurant even looked like. All I saw was red.  As I said before, I will give this place another chance if the opportunity ever presents itself, but rest assured my first order of business will be to point the server out to the hostess that will NOT be taking care of me.
I ordered the hawaiian pizza. For $15 I would expect a better pizza. Maybe I just don't like California style pizza.  This place is not worth  it. I'll never go back.

Think twice about take out I ordered the grilled chicken chimichurri and got 3 small, overcooked pieces of chicken (2 oz) and a container full of soggy vegetables for $15. When asked, I was told by their team that there should be at least 6 oz of chicken. Not impressed, CPK.. Had to go back out to get food somewhere else. UPDATE: The manager contacted me, listened, and is asking me to give them a second chance on the house based on the feedback.

I love the food at CPK, however they aren't very stroller friendly. It seems like every time we go they want me to leave my stroller up at the front. I'm not comfortable with that for several reasons. My son likes to sit in his stroller to eat and I can't see the stroller from the dinning room when it's folded up at the front (with it as busy as it gets at the town center, you know the hostesses aren't watching the stuff up there), just to name a couple. I like my stroller and I wouldn't put it past someone to walk off with it, just saying!! I do really love the carnitias tacos and if you love bacon I recommend the BLT pizza!!

Good food, variety of selections on the menu, great staffs with perfect location. The loyalty program is a plus. Pizza is great, salad is good, and top it off with dessert. If you are not too hungry, try small bites menu. Lovely!
Nice spot for lunch if you are shopping at the town center.

So I've been here three times and they haven't disappointed me yet.  Yes, I know it's another chain, but sometimes you just want to go somewhere where you know everyone in the family will find something to be happy with.   Plus if you just don't want to leave that part of the Town Center to go eat somewhere else, the wait is a lot less than at P.F. Chang's and Cheesecake Factory.   I am in LOVE with their fish tacos.   Yeah, I'm weird that way, going to a pizza place for the fish tacos.  But they're so tasty!  The cabbage is sometimes a little hard, but I love the sauce they put on it, and the fish itself has a nice flavor.  I did stray once and got the Italian sandwich.  Good sized portion, with lots of meat, but I didn't like the slaw.  My daughter got the white pizza and didn't like it because t had spinach on it, but that's a personal preference, there was nothing wrong with the pizza itself.  Plus she's spoiled from the white pizza at Moon River in Fernandina.  As am I.  The Mediterranean plate appetizer/small plate is also very good.  I could lick that hummus off the plate if people wouldn't stare. Finally, we have never had anything but attentive and friendly servers.  Even when they get really busy, they always swing by with refills or a to-go box without prompting.

Dropped in for a pepperoni pizza & a cold draft beer.   It was a nice afternoon so we sat at their outside patio and people watched.   They do have a great location at the center of the St. John's Center.    And, that's as good as it gets.   Their draft beer selection was very limited - just three including bud light.  The pizza was a big disappointment - we've had better frozen pizza that what they served us.    My advise is to drive to the near by mellow mushroom if you want a great pizza and a wide selection of draft beers.

It had been a while since I visited a CPK and there seems to be quite a few changes to the menu including mostly thin crust pizzas and less options.  I was not disappointed in my food however, it was just not what I remembered.  Avocado eggrolls were hot and delicious.

Went there for lunch after church today. Nice location in St Johns Town Center, but I wasn't thrilled with the food. Kind of pricey for the amount and quality.  Average food at above average prices. One member loved her salad: but a "half' salad for $14? Grilled chicken sandwich for $14? It was one chicken breast split in two, grilled with Dijon mustard. That's what the menu said, but I figured it would be more tasty than just grilled chicken with Dijon mustard. I can do that at home!  Probably won't be going back. I really wish I could write a glowing review, because it was a nice place. But I expect more bang for my buck.

We've tried CPK several times and have had decent dining experience most of the times.  Sometimes it gets too crazy and noisy, given the location.  Everytime we went, we would try different specialy pizza and most of them tasted pretty good while sometimes can get a bit salty.  Overall, the location is very convenient when you are shopping at the Town Center, the food is decent (a bit on the salty side), the price slightly higher, and makes this an average restaurant for me.
This California Pizza Kitchen is located in the St Johns Town Center Mall.  Great pizza and salads.

CPK has only been open for less than a week and this would normally be the time for restaurants to be working out the kinks, but there aren't a whole lot of faults to point out.  Like any other CPK (at least, the ones I've been to in Orlando, Dallas, and Atlanta), the atmosphere is modern and bright, the waitstaff are friendly and quick on the drink refills, and the food is fresh and served in ginormous portions.   I had the California Club focaccia sandwich with asparagus soup and the GF had the cheeseburger pizza (which, btw, tasted EXACTLY like a Big Mac - special sauce and everything).  The best thing about the sandwich was the garlic focaccia - tasty and chewy, but not so much that you dislocate your jaw muscles.  We also ordered the lettuce wraps which tasted and looked suspiciously similar to the ones at P.F. Chang's.   Negatives?  1: The wait time was long, but that's to be expected at any new restaurant in the Town Center.  2: There were, like, 5 managers hovering around nervously and getting in the waiters' way.  All 5 asked how how our meals were which was pleasant the first time, humorous the next two times, and freaking annoying the remaining times. 3: The shrimp scampi pizza was no longer on the menu.  But, the pear gorgonzola pizza was back on, so I considered that to be an even trade.

This California Pizza Kitchen has somehow found the ideal way to play music in the background, but still be quiet enough where you can hear the person across from you. The waitress staff is dainty, but effective. The food is tasty and not heavy, so you'll feel hungry again in a few hours. The location is spacious and scenic, especially for those who enjoy people watching. I've been to this location a few times and it seems like the menu is completely different every time I arrive. By doing this, I haven't been able to develop a favorite dish. And if I don't have a favorite dish, I can't say that there's something I'm eagerly waiting for when the idea of going to CPK comes up. Despite the restaurants name, this place does not offer nearly as fantastic a pizza as, say, Mellow Mushroom. However, the prices are cheaper than Mellow and perhaps that's because the powers at be want people in the Town Center shopping for clothes and jewelry and not sitting and stuffing their faces. Your food comes out in a reasonable time and the outdoor patio is decent. Other than that, this CPK is just OK.
Jamaican jerk chicken pizza is solid!!!

I've been here 3 times, most recently on Friday night. We just beat the big rush at about 6:30...had a short wait before we were seated, and had good service. My husb loves the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza and has ordered it each time. I have had the Works pizza (yum), Cobb Salad (also yum), and Korean BBQ Steak tacos (tasty but soooo tiny - not at all worth the price). The kid's menu has a nice variety and is reasonable.  Recommend the fusilli with meat sauce if your kid likes spaghetti type meals.  Good stuff!

I'd heard many great things about this place, so when it opened in the Summer of 2010, we decided to check it out. Both her and I were not pleased. The wait was long, the service was incredibly slow, and the food was not that great either. Despite our bad experience, we decided to give CPK another try and still were not pleased.

I would give them 5 stars if the prices were more reasonable . The food is very good, I actually enjoy the sandwiches a lot and they have delicious unique salads. I wouldn't consider it a typical pizza place as their variety of pizzas are meant to be unique and not "italian or NY" style. Glad it is at the center of the towncenter as a more casual option than others around but with a nice sit down atmosphere. But prices are a bit steep for what it is.

I've been to several CPK locations throughout the U.S. This one is very nice. I've been twice and was satisfied with the food and service. I like the lettuce wraps. It's a good lunch or dinner option if you're at the St. John's Town Center. The best part is the outdoor patio that lends to great people-watching.

First time to California Pizza Kitchen.  Decided to pick up two pizzas to take home for dinner.  Place looks clean and well maintained.  I stood at the Carry Out counter for about 10 minutes before someone would stop to take my order.  I ordered the "original" BBQ Chicken and the Five Cheese and Tomato, $25.65, OK should be good.  15 minutes later my order is brought to me as I sit on the chairs along the wall, reading the menu.  She brings out the two boxes?  No bag?  Really,you're going to just throw a couple boxes at me?   I ask for and received a paper bag (want to keep them warm during the 10 minute ride home. I open the boxes , pizzas are 10 inches across and no toppings or sauce along the outer inch, so in reality, an 8 inch pizza for $13?  I bite into the BBQ Chicken and I'm greeted with the taste of FLOUR,  just FLOUR!  the entire bottom is covered in flour and that's all you taste for the first 2 or 3 chews.  The pizza is DRY, lacks enough sauce.  Chicken looks like chunk white meat...that's fair in taste.  If I ever ordered this again, ask for "double sauce". 5 Cheese and Tomato, same flour taste, but it'is moist .  Outer edge of this pizza also lacks anything...No Cheese, No tomato.  The white sauce and or cheese pairing is good, but not great.  Overall,  I would NOT recommend the pizza at the place.  Perhaps the other dishes are worthy of a sampling?

The first time I tried CPK was in Las Vegas several years ago.  I thought it was fantabulous.  Since CPK has come to Jax, I've been twice and not impressed.  I split a thin Hawaiian pizza with my party and and it was burnt on the bottom.  The CPK location nice and weather was pretty enough to have lunch outside on the patio.

One of the better places in St. John's Town-center. There is some times a wait. However, in my past experiences it is not very long. The food is the same as any cpk. I recommend the pizza or the waldorf salad.

Good service.  I got my usual, the Baby Clam Linguine.  I get it half tomato, half creamy.  Tasty!  I like the location in an outdoor mall.  It's very cozy for dinner when shopping.  Try to get a table near the windows so you can people watch while you eat.

Went here on a busy Saterday afternoon for lunch.  The service was slow and the pizza was lousy.  The southwestern egg rolls were good.  I have bought their frozen pizzas from the supermarket and I think that's actually what they served me in the restaurant too.  It was a pepperoni pizza.  Pretty sure it was microwaved.

Great location at the Town Center.  With that said- TOWN CENTER. People complaining about the price need to go eat at McDonalds. I mean, come on! It's right there with Maggiano's, Cheesecake Factory, P.F. Changs... get real! I much preferred the atmosphere for a family place to eat. Great for kids! My greek pizza was $12 and completely worth it. It took me back to Greece, especially with the tzatziki sauce! Yum! Hubby had the white pizza with applewood bacon. Also very yummy. We even had the chocolate soufflé with the ice cream for dessert.  The staff was very friendly and helpful! Our server was great- quick on refills and accommodating our needs. This will definitely be added to one of our go to places to eat!

No one to greet me at the door at 8:15pm on a Thursday. Fail. I have been to this place in other cities and they had good food. But this one sucks. Other people came in after me and waited as well. I waited 5 minutes with literally no greeter or any employee talking to me. Then I left. Wish I could give zero stars for failed customer service. I will try to email corporate on this one.

We stopped in at California Pizza Kitchen in the St. Johns Town Center prompted by a flyer from the University of North Florida's Relay for Life organization. The flyer indicated that on Nov. 28th, 20% of our bill went to the American Cancer Society's UNF Relay for Life fundraising effort. We had not dined in this California Pizza Kitchen before but had enjoyed two previous visits to the location in Waterford Lakes (Orlando), FL. We were not disappointed! Our server, Dean, was courteous, prompt, and anticipated our every request. This fella was a top-notch server. We ordered the Crispy Mac n' Cheese for an appetizer, which was delicious and the perfect size (four small samples for $3.75). Another in the party enjoyed the Dakota pea soup, which smelled heavenly. Two shared a Sicilian pizza which was loaded with Italian meats, and quite ample for $14. I enjoyed the Chicken Milanese for $15.50. It was three boneless chicken breasts dipped in panko bread crumbs and lightly fried, then topped with arugula and a tomato/olive oil concoction which was light and tasty. The cranberry cooler ($2.50) was a nice change from the usual drink of sweet tea (and included free refills), and hubs enjoyed a cappuccino ($4.25) after the meal. Since it was a fundraiser, we splurged on two scrumptious desserts to share. First was a warm butter cake ($6.25) that was out of this world delicious; the second was a chocolate souffle with Haagen Dazs ice cream -- yum, yum, yum (@ $7.75). We dined about 7 p.m. and expected a wait, but were seated immediately. There are many wonderful eatiers in the St. Johns Town Center, many are more pricey, but don't miss California Pizza Kitchen. We applaud their spirit of community service as well as their delicious entrees and professional service. Thanks for a great evening!
